Description: Papyrus containing 19 lines of text with traces of two additional lines on the recto and the ends of 6 lines of text in a different hand on the verso. The text on the recto is a contract concerning an inheritance. The contracting parties are a woman named Platonis alias Ophelia and a woman named Heras.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (21996) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/21996)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2013, - 2014 21 Sep - 05 Jan, Bristol Museum + Art Gallery, Roman Empire: Power + People 2014, 25 Jan - 27 Apr, Norwich Castle, Roman Empire + People 2014, 15 May - 31 Aug, Coventry, Herbert Museum, Roman Empire + People 2014 -2015, 20 Sep - 4 Jan, Manchester, Roman Empire + People 2015, 24 Jan - 10 May, Dundee, Roman Empire + People 2015, 30 May - 13 Sep, Tyne & Wear, Roman Empire + People
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Colgate Rochester Divinity School
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.Oxy. XIV 1721 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
